intro: Sarothamnus obtusatus, commonly known as the bluntleaf thornstep, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing shrub with woody stems and small, gray-green leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces yellow flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as scrublands and coastal areas. Sarothamnus obtusatus is adapted to withstand drought and has a long lifespan, making it a resilient species in its native environment.
